meanings.definition: relating to elections or the process of voting
meanings.sent1: The electoral system determines who will be the leader.
meanings.sent2: The electoral college plays a crucial role in choosing the president.
meanings.sent3: The electoral results were so close, they had to flip a coin to decide the winner!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an electoral victory, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The electoral campaign was filled with excitement and anticipation.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the selection of a candidate by vote
meanings.sent1: The electoral process allows the people to choose their representatives.
meanings.sent2: The electoral debate helped voters make an informed decision.
meanings.sent3: His electoral speech was so persuasive, even the birds stopped to listen!
meanings.sent4: The candidate's charm was an electoral magnet, drawing supporters from all corners.
meanings.sent5: The electoral event brought the community together in a spirit of democracy.

meanings.definition: involving or relating to the process of choosing a representative by voting
meanings.sent1: The electoral committee oversees the fairness of the voting process.
meanings.sent2: The electoral laws ensure equal opportunity for all candidates.
meanings.sent3: The electoral decision was so unexpected, it felt like a plot twist in a movie!
meanings.sent4: Her victory speech was an electoral symphony, resonating with hope and unity.
meanings.sent5: The electoral outcome reflected the voice of the people loud and clear.
